abstract: HDNet, the cable channel owned by the billionaire sports and media mogul Mark Cuban, will become AXS TV this summer — a joint venture of Mr. Cuban, Ryan Seacrest’s media holding company, the talent agency CAA and the events promoter A.E.G.
snippet: HDNet, the cable channel owned by the billionaire sports and media mogul Mark Cuban, will become AXS TV this summer — a joint venture of Mr. Cuban, Ryan Seacrest’s media holding company, the talent agency CAA and the events promoter A.E.G.
lead_paragraph: 6:25 p.m. | Updated Ryan Seacrest, his talent agency CAA and the events promoter A.E.G. have been talking for three years about making a cable channel for concerts, live events and other entertainment.

headline.main: Concerts to Be Focus in Shift From HDNet to AXS TV
